definitions.definition: A person paid to endorse a product while pretending to be impartial .
examples: carnival barkers and their shills , fleecing the rubes

definitions.definition: Any person enthusiastically endorsing a product; especially, one who is getting paid for the endorsement.
examples: On the screen, there was that quack again, playing the shill for yet another drug company.

definitions.definition: An accomplice at a confidence trick during an auction or gambling game, such as an accomplice of the seller who bids to drive up the price.
examples: Sniping is necessary because if you bid before the last minute it just gives the shills more time to screw you over.

definitions.definition: A house player in a casino.

main_definition: A person paid to endorse a product while pretending to be impartial .
secondary_definitions: ( derogatory ) Any person enthusiastically endorsing a product; especially, one who is getting paid for the endorsement.
An accomplice at a confidence trick during an auction or gambling game, such as an accomplice of the seller who bids to drive up the price.
( gambling ) A house player in a casino.
